result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brad J. Harrison

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 1:06 p.m. 
Defendant appears in person, pro se;
Date and time set for a review hearing.

COURT notes Defendant has bonded out, and notes SPD is still searching for counsel.
Defendant wishes to delay prelim so he can get an atty.
COURT finds good cause to toll time limits. 

DATES:
Remove PH.
RH: 11/11/22 @ 1:00 p.m. 

Adjourned: 1:08 p.m.

Review hearing on November 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:50 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 7, 2022 at 09:50 am.

No contact with victim(s):  F.D.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Case Called: 2:33 pm.
Clerk: Nicole.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence.  Defendant appears in custody from MCJ, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Julie Sawyer.

Date and time set for initial appearance; VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

BOND:  $500.00 cash bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): F.D.
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
PH: 11/9/22 @ 9:50 am. Br. 1.
RH: 11/4/22 @ 1:00 pm.
PTC: 12/7/22 @ 9:50 am. Br. 6.

Adjourned: 2:38 pm.
